intro: Paullinia carpopodea subf. affinis, commonly known as the Brazilian grapefruit tree, is a species belonging to the Sapindaceae family. It is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves and clusters of yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to citrus fruits, though they are not true citrus. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and fruit, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and culinary purposes.
